newsitem.title: USA: Panama Brady bonds soar after rating actions.
newsitem.headline: Panama Brady bonds soar after rating actions.

text.p: Panamanian debt prices surged after Moody's Investors Service Inc assigned the Brady debt instruments a Ba1 rating and Standard and Poor's Corp assigned the country's Brady bonds a BB-plus rating.

Shortly after the Moody's rating was announced, Panama's PDI bonds PAPDI=RR jumped five percentage points to 87-1/2 followed by another 5/8 gain after S&P's action sent the PDI bonds up to the current bid price of 88-1/2. The country's FRNs PAFRN=RR rose 1/2 to 98-1/4.
"We think there is still room for more price appreciation," said one trader at a European Bank in New York.

In Moody's assessment of Panama, the rating agency said it believed that the country's external debt burden was manageable, and added that the economic reforms being implemented by the current government should provide a basis for improved economic performance over the next several years.

Separately, S&P said the country's creditworthiness is supported by Panama's deepening economic reforms as well as the country's 92-year track record of full dollarization which should continue to support low inflation, balance of payments equilibrium and ample domestic credit availability.
